wikipedia_page.main: Hugh Edward Montgomery  (born 20 October 1962) is an English professor of medicine and the director of the Centre for Human Health and Performance at University College London. He discovered that an allele of the gene with the DNA code for angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) influences physical fitness; this was the first discovery of a gene related to fitness.

link_mentions.page: The Voyage of the Arctic Tern
response: The Voyage of the Arctic Tern is a children's verse novel written by Hugh Montgomery and illustrated by Nick Poullis.  It tells the story of an ancient ship and its captain, who seeks redemption because he has been cursed with eternal life.
Hugh Montgomery was born and raised in the coastal city of Plymouth, England. He developed a love for the sea early in life, inspired by his own grandfather, a former ship's captain.
